;;2023-11-01T21:04:15Z;
;
;;长发的中东女人和穿着西装、打着粉色领带的向后梳头发的白人男子，两人都微笑着，坐着法庭前面的长桌旁，许多老年人坐在他们后面的长凳上。
;

;周三，小唐纳德·特朗普在针对他父亲和家族企业的正在进行的欺诈审判中出庭作证，并试图与自己保持距离。财务报表是案件的核心。

;

;特朗普 45 岁的长子是 ;第一个在纽约总检察长利蒂西亚·詹姆斯提起的民事审判中作证的家庭成员。他的弟弟埃里克预计将于周四出庭作证，特朗普和他的女儿伊万卡预计下周出庭。

;

;在法庭上，由于特朗普的律师询问了先前的证人，小特朗普的证词被推迟，因此他表现得彬彬有礼。 “我应该化妆，”当摄影师在他作证之前给他拍照时，他开玩笑说。

;
;

;;相关：;;“期待意外”：特朗普欺诈案审判变成家庭事务;< /p>;

;

;当被要求放慢速度时，语速很快的小特朗普说道：“我很抱歉，法官大人。我搬到了佛罗里达州，但我保持了纽约的步伐。”

;

;小特朗普被问及一系列有关他、他的父亲和特朗普前首席财务官艾伦·韦塞尔伯格 (Allen Weisselberg) 作为受托人的角色的问题。唐纳德·J·特朗普可撤销信托基金，该信托基金为前总统的“专有利益”持有资产。

;

;当被问及他的父亲是否仍然是该信托基金的受托人时，小特朗普说：“我不记得了”

;

;他说他记不太清了，包括为什么在 2021 年有一段短暂的时期他辞职了，然后又恢复了信托。小特朗普表示，“我有做我想做的事情的自主权”，但他咨询了魏塞尔伯格和其他人的意见。当被问及他在创建本案核心财务报表中所扮演的角色时，小特朗普表示：“会计师们对此进行了工作。这就是我们付钱给他们的原因。”

;

;本周早些时候，小特朗普表现得更加好斗。在周一接受右翼有线电视频道 Newsmax 采访时，他声称“主流媒体、[华盛顿]特区的人们……希望将特朗普投入一千年的监狱和/或死刑。真正恶心的东西，但这就是我们战斗的原因”。

;

;詹姆斯指责特朗普、他的长子和其他特朗普高管欺诈性地夸大前总统的财富，以从银行获得更好的贷款。

; < p>;在一个例子中，詹姆斯说特朗普声称他的特朗普大厦三层公寓面积为 30,000 平方英尺，而不是实际面积 10,996 平方英尺。

;

;法官阿瑟·恩戈伦 (Arthur Engoron) 已经裁定特朗普家族犯有欺诈行为。他正在举行审判，以确定应给予的处罚。詹姆斯要求支付 2.5 亿美元，并取消特朗普在纽约的营业执照，此举将终止特朗普家族在该州经营企业的能力。

;

;当天早些时候，司法部长之一目击者就他认为银行因特朗普涉嫌欺诈而遭受的损失作证。米契尔·麦卡蒂 (Michiel McCarty)，投资银行 MM Dillon & 董事长兼首席执行官公司表示，特朗普财富的膨胀使特朗普组织能够获得更好的贷款利率。他计算出银行因此损失了超过 1.68 亿美元的利息。

;

;特朗普的律师声称银行没有被误导。

;

;“如果特朗普的律师克里斯托弗·基斯 (Christopher Kise) 表示：“银行没有证明它会采取不同的做法。”

;

;“我认为这些都是不义之财。”恩戈隆回答道。

;

;唐纳德·特朗普否认了这一说法。所有不当行为，这位美国前总统周三并未出庭，但在社交媒体上再次抨击了审判。 “别打扰我的孩子们，恩戈隆。你是法律界的耻辱！”周三早上，他在社交媒体上写道。

;

;特朗普在一篇帖子中攻击恩戈伦是“政治黑客”，最后写道：“政治迫害！！！选举干扰！！！”

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 05:22:01 +0800 Matthew Perry ‘happy and chipper’ before death, say Friends creatorshttps://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2023/nov/01/matthew-perry-happy-chipper-before-death-friends-creators
;;2023-11-01T16:26:46Z;
;
;;马修·佩里饰演钱德勒·宾。
;

;《老友记》的创作者回忆起他们与马修的最后一次对话佩里在去世前不久表示他“处于一个非常好的状态”。

;

;在哥伦比亚广播公司《今日》节目的联合采访中，玛塔·考夫曼和大卫·克兰也讨论了他们对佩里去世消息的震惊。周六 54 岁。

;

;“他很快乐，精神抖擞，”考夫曼在谈到她与佩里的谈话时说道。佩里在这部热门情景喜剧的 10 季中扮演了深受喜爱的钱德勒·宾。 “他似乎没有被任何事情压垮。他的处境非常好，这就是为什么这看起来如此不公平。”

;

;考夫曼说，上周末听到这个消息后，她“非常震惊”。洛杉矶警察局称，这名演员被发现在洛杉矶家中的热水浴缸中失去知觉。他的死因仍在调查中。

;

;“老实说，我的第一反应是给他发短信。然后是深深的悲伤。如此多的悲伤。这很难理解，”她说。 “前一分钟他还在这儿，还很高兴，然后就噗嗤一声。并在世界上行善。确实在世界上做好事。

;

;“他看起来比我一段时间以来见过的都要好。我很高兴看到这一点。他在情感上处于一个很好的位置。他看起来不错。他戒烟了。是的，他很清醒。他在整个过程中学到了很多东西，而他学到的最重要的是他想帮助其他瘾君子，这给了他目标。”

;

;佩里在他的回忆录中写道，他公开谈论了他与毒瘾和清醒的斗争。朋友、恋人，以及青少年时期酗酒以及 1997 年一次水上摩托艇事故后他对止痛药上瘾的可怕事件。

;

;联合主持人 Hoda Kotb 向 Crane 询问 Perry 之前的评论人们会“对他的去世感到震惊，但并不感到惊讶”。

;

;他说：“考虑到他所经历的旅程，而且我们都知道这一点，总有一部分是善意的为这样的事情做好准备。很难相信，因为他是一个活生生的人，很难相信他不在这里。”

; ;

;克兰说，虽然他认为佩里会理解他对人们的影响， “同时我想知道……他能够在多大程度上将其内化并从中找到安慰。”制片人表示，他们了解佩里多年来的成瘾历程，他们的首要任务是支持

;

;“实际上，我在重聚（于 2021 年播出）之后就与他谈论了这件事，”考夫曼说。 “一旦他接受治疗，他就对此持开放态度。除非他在使用。”

;

;在采访结束时，她说：“我以多种方式失去了一位朋友，令人惊奇的是那些也失去了朋友的粉丝们的倾诉。我希望无论他身在何处，他都能感受到这一点。”

;

;詹妮弗·安妮斯顿、柯特妮·考克斯、丽莎·库卓、马特·勒布朗和大卫·施维默;树木上方晴朗天空中盘状不明飞行物的颗粒状黑白照片。;

;五角大楼针对某些不明异常现象（以前称为不明飞行物）的遭遇推出了在线报告工具，以扩大他们对未知事物的探索更加透明的努力。

;

;仅限当前或以前的情况到目前为止，联邦雇员或那些“直接了解自 1945 年以来与 UAP 相关的美国政府计划或活动”的人有资格使用周二上线的安全表格 ;在国防部的网站;上，其名称有点温和;全域异常解决办公室;（Aaro）。

;

;公众可以选择官员们表示，提交报告即将到来。此举标志着政府正在慢慢接近履行其承诺，即对自己知道或不知道的一切完全公开，从天空中的奇怪闪光到外星生命的可能性和不寻常飞行器的目击事件。;

;

;;相关：;;美国宇航局任命 UFO 研究主管，并计划众包目击事件的帮助;

;
;

;该工具的推出遵循;上个月任命;前五角大楼联络员马克·麦金纳尼 (Mark McInerney) 为美国宇航局首任 UAP 研究主任，航天局承诺利用一个;全球公民天空观察者大军;，以改进对陌生事物的观察和分析。

;

;Aaro 在其网站上表示，新表格“旨在作为初始联系点……并非旨在传达潜在的敏感或机密信息”。

;

;有关 UAP 或遭遇的二手信息它说，这种做法是不受欢迎的。 Aaro 主任肖恩·柯克帕特里克 (Sean Kirkpatrick) 周二对记者表示，第一手资料，尤其是政府参与的 UAP 项目的第一手资料，肯定是并且将会受到敏感和保密的对待。

;

;“这种报告机制正在建立该网站是为那些认为自己对政府一直隐藏的秘密项目拥有第一手资料的人准备的，”他说。 “[如果]飞行员在飞来飞去，他在自己的领空看到了一些东西，并且需要报告，那么就会通过运营渠道进行报告。”

;

;关于政府参与 UFO 程度和对 UFO 的了解程度的阴谋论UAP 研究和项目已经流传了数十年，源自关于一个秘密政府设施保存外星飞船和生命体的传言：;莫哈韦沙漠中的 51 区;，流行电视节目中对该主题的虚构化，例如 ;X 档案;。

;

;柯克帕特里克说那些坚持这种信念的人可能会失望。

;

;“我目前没有任何证据表明曾经存在过任何进行任何类型的逆向工程、任何类型的外星 UAP 项目的项目，”他说。

;

;“法律确实要求我们将举报人或其他认为确实存在这种情况的受访者带进来，并且他们可能拥有与此相关的信息。”

;

;值得注意的是，他暗示即将公开传播一些以前保密的信息。

;

;“我们已经准备好发布一揽子新材料。我们发现了一些我们正在解密的事情。不仅仅是操作视频，还有历史文件。”他说，但没有提供详细信息。

;

;他将其描述为“有助于向公众通报信息的教育材料”。

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 04:52:01 +0800 Scarlett Johansson takes legal action against use of image for AIhttps://www.theguardian.com/film/2023/nov/01/scarlett-johansson-artificial-intelligence-ad
;;2023-11-01T20:24:51Z;
;
;;X 上发布的 22 秒广告使用了 AI 生成的演员图像和对话。
;< p>;斯嘉丽约翰逊已对一款人工智能应用程序采取法律行动，该应用程序未经她的许可，在人工智能生成的广告中使用了她的名字和肖像。

;

;这则 22 秒的广告发布在 X（该平台以前称为 X）上。 Twitter，由一款名为 Lisa AI 的图像生成应用程序开发：90 年代年鉴和阿凡达，使用约翰逊的真实镜头为她生成假图像和对话。

;
;

;;相关：;;英国、美国、欧盟和中国签署人工智能“灾难性”危险声明;

;
;

;这位 38 岁演员的代表确认 ;Variety;称她不是该公司的发言人，自 10 月 28 日被发现以来已采取了适当的法律行动。 “我们不会掉以轻心地对待这些事情。根据我们在这种情况下的惯常行动方针，我们将采取一切法律补救措施来处理此事，”她的律师凯文·约恩 (Kevin Yorn) 告诉《综艺》杂志。该广告现已被撤下。

;

;该视频经 Variety 审核，以一段约翰逊在漫威电影《黑寡妇》片场的幕后花絮开始。 “大家怎么了？我是斯嘉丽，我希望你跟我一起去……”她说道，然后屏幕转变成人工智能生成的与她相似的照片。一个模仿演员的声音继续宣传该应用程序：“它不仅限于头像。您还可以创建带有文本的图像，甚至是 AI 视频。我认为你不应该错过它。”假旁白说道。

;

;广告下方的小字写着：“图像由 Lisa AI 制作。与这个人无关。” Lisa AI 的多款应用程序仍然保留在 App Store 和 Google Play 上。

;

;Johansson 并不是唯一一个公开反对人工智能使用自己的名字和肖像的演员。上个月，汤姆·汉克斯在 Instagram 上警告粉丝，一项牙科计划在宣传视频中使用了人工智能生成的汤姆·汉克斯图像。 “谨防！ ……我与此无关。”他在 Instagram 故事中写道。 com/technology/2023/jul/10/sarah-silverman-sues-openai-meta-copyright-infringement">;起诉;由 OpenAI 和 Facebook 母公司 Meta 开发的 ChatGPT 侵犯版权，声称其人工情报模型在未经同意的情况下接受了工作训练。

;

;这也不是约翰逊第一次经历未经同意而使用她的图像的情况。 2018 年，这位演员对 ;《华盛顿邮报》; 关于在计算机生成的“深度伪造”中使用她的图像，其中女性的面孔被人为地添加到色情视频中。 “没有什么可以阻止有人将我或其他人的图像剪切并粘贴到不同的身体上，并使其看起来像想要的那样异常逼真，”她说。 “互联网上基本上没有规则，因为它是一个几乎无法无天的深渊，尽管美国的政策只适用于这里。”

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 04:52:01 +0800 Liz Cheney calls new House speaker ‘dangerous’ for January 6 rolehttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/nov/01/liz-cheney-mike-johnson-involved-january-6-2020-election
;;2023-11-01T17:55:17Z;
;
;;利兹·切尼说：“让他当选众议院议长，这是一个令人担忧的时刻。”
;

;前怀俄明州共和党众议员、1 月 6 日委员会副主席利兹·切尼 (Liz Cheney) 表示，美国众议院新任共和党议长迈克·约翰逊 (Mike Johnson) 是“危险的”，因为他在唐纳德·特朗普 (Donald Trump) 试图推翻 2020 年大选的过程中发挥了作用。< /p>;

;“他的行为方式他知道是错误的，”切尼告诉 ;政治就是一切; ，来自弗吉尼亚大学政治中心的播客。 “我认为不幸的是，这个国家将会看到他的品格。”

;
;

;;相关：;;前特朗普律师在密钥对折叠后争夺佐治亚州认罪协议;

;
;

;她补充道：“像迈克·约翰逊这样的人之所以危险，原因之一是……你们选出了更了解情况的共和党人，选出了了解真相但仍会支持破坏我们共和国的努力的共和党人：坦率地说，唐纳德·特朗普为推翻选举所做的努力。”

;

;约翰逊 ;关于乔·拜登在 2020 年获胜的阴谋论;；撰写了最高法院;147 名共和党人;之一即使在特朗普支持者袭击国会大厦后，仍反对关键州的结果。

;

;2021 年 1 月 6 日的事件现已导致 9 人死亡、数千人被捕和数百人被定罪，其中一些人因煽动阴谋而被定罪。特朗普因试图颠覆选举而面临州和联邦指控（总共涉及 91 项犯罪罪名），但仍然在共和党总统初选民意调查中占据主导地位。

;

;切尼是 1 月 6 日众议院的两名反特朗普共和党人之一委员会去年举行了黄金时段听证会并编写了一份报告。在怀俄明州，她的席位输给了一位支持特朗普的挑战者。另一位 1 月 6 日的共和党人、伊利诺伊州的亚当·金辛格 (Adam Kinzinger) 选择辞职。

;

;与金辛格一样，切尼现在也写了一本回忆录，题为《誓言与荣誉：回忆录与警告》。她还拒绝平息有关她可能作为共和党建制派代表竞选总统的猜测——她的父亲是前国防部长兼副总统迪克·切尼——试图阻止特朗普再次夺取白宫。

;

;约翰逊上个月升任议长，在三名候选人未能获得足够的支持来接替凯文·麦卡锡(Kevin McCarthy)后一致当选，后者被党内极右翼亲特朗普派驱逐。

;

;新议长的极右派、受基督教影响的言论和立场受到了广泛的审查。

;

;切尼告诉;她的播客主持人兼 UVA 教授拉里·萨巴托;：“迈克是我很熟悉的人。”

;

;“我们 [2016 年]一起当选。我们的办公室彼此相邻，迈克自称致力于捍卫宪法。但这并不是他在 2020 年大选后我们所有人都面临考验时所做的事情。

;

;“根据我的经验，当迈克做事时，作为会议主席，我非常非常深入地参与其中。就像说服会议成员签署法庭之友陈述一样……在我看来，他愿意搁置他所知道的法院裁决和宪法要求，以安抚唐纳德·特朗普，以便为了获得唐纳德·特朗普的赞扬，出于政治目的。

;

;“因此，让他当选众议院议长是一个令人担忧的时刻。”

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Sam Bankman-Fried built ‘pyramid of deceit’, jurors hear in closing argumentshttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/nov/01/sam-bankman-fried-trial-closing-arguments
;;2023-11-01T18:40:44Z;
;
;;Bankman-Fried 面临七项阴谋和欺诈罪。
;

;;Sam Bankman-Fried; 的加密货币;欺诈审判即将进行;经过数周的证词，揭开了 FTX 令人震惊的崩溃的面纱，以及围绕数字货币市场的更广泛的黑暗面，周三曼哈顿联邦法院的结案陈词结束了。检方很快将山姆·班克曼-弗里德描绘成一个毫不掩饰的骗子，而不是;任性的数学呆子;在整个审判过程中被辩方提出，称他通过加密货币交易所 FTX 创建了一个“欺骗金字塔”。

;

;美国助理检察官尼古拉斯鲁斯还使用了班克曼-弗里德自己的证词来指控他。

;

;“他从来没有说过他不记得了，”鲁斯说，但当轮到检察官时，这种自称缺乏记忆的情况“在盘问过程中发生了 140 多次”。

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 03:22:01 +0800 Serbia’s president dissolves parliament and calls early electionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/01/serbias-president-dissolves-parliament-and-calls-early-election

;
;;Aleksandar Vučić signs a decree to dissolve parliament in his office
;

;Serbia's president, Aleksandar Vučić, has dissolved parliament and called early parliamentary and municipal elections for 17 December, less than two years after his Serbian Progressive party (SNS) won the last ballot.

;

;“We live in times that are difficult for the whole world, in times of global challenges, wars and conflicts when it is necessary that we are all united in preserving vital national and state interests of Republic of Serbia,” Vučić said on Wednesday.

;

;The Serbian president is widely seen as seeking to buy time to cement his authority as he tries to work out how to best normalise ties with independent, predominantly Albanian Kosovo, which Serbia still sees as its southern province.

;

;Several Serbian opposition parties officially asked for the vote in September after the coalition government failed to accept demands from mass protests that erupted after back-to-back shootings in May that killed 18 people, half of them children.

;

;The protest organisers accused the ruling party and government-friendly media outlets of fanning a culture of violence. The parliamentary election will coincide with local votes in 65 municipalities, including the capital, Belgrade.

;

;Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission, said on a visit to Belgrade on Tuesday that Serbia and Kosovo must step up their efforts to normalise relations after the recent flare-up of violence if they want to join the EU.

;

;Belgrade will also need to back western sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, root out corruption and organised crime, reform the economy and improve the judiciary, the business climate and its human rights record, the bloc has said.

;

;At the last elections in April 2022, the conservative SNS – which has been in power since 2012 – and its partners won 120 of the 250 seats in parliament. Vučić, a former hardline nationalist, was elected for a second term as president.

;

;Serbia's main opposition parties boycotted the 2020 elections and decried the process as neither free nor fair.

;

;Analysts have said the president's move is also aimed at bolstering his own support and reforming the SNS, whose popularity has slipped after months of opposition protests after the two mass shootings in May.

;

;Polls suggest an SNS-led coalition would receive about 44% of votes and would have to seek allies for a majority. The centrist opposition bloc, Against the Violence, is on about 38%, and ultranationalist and pro-Russian parties could jointly win 11%.

;

;Vučić resigned as the head of SNS in May but still wields considerable influence in the party. Opponents have accused him and his allies of autocracy, stifling the media, election fraud, violence, corruption and links to organised crime.

;

;Kosovans believe Vučić's decision to call elections partly explains why he did not agree to a US-EU solution for managing northern Kosovo after five hours of meetings in Brussels last week involving senior EU leaders.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'Graffiti battle on streets of Belgrade' as Serbia tries to stifle anti-Putin Russian exiles;

;
;

;Although Kosovo agreed to all parts of the plan, which was put to the leaders in Serbia and Kosovo in separate meetings the previous Saturday, Vučić refused to sign it.

;

;Kosovo has long suspected Serbia would not sign any agreement for self-management of the northern municipalities, where the population is Serbian dominated, because it would be a step on the road to official recognition of Kosovo by Belgrade.

;

;Von der Leyen told Vučić and Kosovo's prime minister, Albin Kurti, on Tuesday that the EU expected Serbia and Kosovo to respect the agreements they made in Ohrid, North Macedonia, this year to normalise their relations.

;

;Von der Leyen met Vučić in Belgrade a day after she asked Serbia to “deliver on de facto recognition of Kosovo”.

;

;After their meetings in Brussels, the senior EU leaders called on Kosovo's leadership to press ahead with the self-management plan, known as the association of Serb-majority municipalities, and for Serbia to deliver on recognition.

;

;;Reuters and Agence-France Presse contributed to this report;

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 02:52:01 +0800 Emmanuel Macron vows to boost French cooperation with Kazakhstanhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/01/emmanuel-macron-vows-to-boost-french-cooperation-with-kazakhstan
;;2023-11-01T17:14:52Z;
;
;;Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev and France's President Emmanuel Macron
;

;The French president ;Emmanuel Macron; has vowed to boost cooperation with Kazakhstan at a time of “multiple crises in the world” as he began a trip to Central Asia, a region long regarded as Russia's backyard which has drawn fresh western attention since the war in Ukraine began.

;

;At a meeting with President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, Macron complimented ;Kazakhstan; for refusing to side with Moscow on Ukraine and announced business deals, including a declaration of intent for a partnership in the much-sought area of rare earths and rare metals.

;

;“I don't underestimate by any means the geopolitical difficulties, the pressures ... that some may be putting on you,” Macron told Tokayev, who called the visit “historic”.

;

;“France values ... the path you are following for your country, refusing to be a vassal of any power and seeking to build numerous and balanced relations with different countries.”

;

;Russia has voiced concern at the west's growing diplomatic activity in former Soviet Central Asian nations.

;

;Although on Wednesday, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Kazakhstan, as a sovereign state, was free to develop ties with any countries, the foreign minister Sergey Lavrov said last week the west was trying to pull Russia's “neighbours, friends and allies” away from it.

;

;France is the fifth-biggest foreign investor in Kazakhstan, ahead of China, mainly because of the involvement of energy giant TotalEnergies in the massive Kashagan offshore oil field project.

;

;Oil-rich Kazakhstan has emerged as a replacement supplier of crude to European nations turning off Russian supply and an important link in the new China-Europe trade route bypassing Russia. Kazakhstan is also a major exporter of uranium, and France's Orano already operates a joint venture with its state nuclear firm Kazatomprom.

;

;Macron and Tokayev signed a series of contracts in sectors ranging from minerals and energy to pharmaceuticals and aerospace.

;

;The French energy giant EDF is in the running to build Kazakhstan's first nuclear power station – a project that is due to be decided on in a referendum this year.

;

;Critical minerals vital for clean energy technologies, which the region has plenty of, were an important part of the talks.

;

;Kazakhstan and ;Uzbekistan;, where Macron will continue his visit, have refused to recognise Russia's annexation of Ukrainian territories and have pledged to abide by western sanctions against Moscow, while calling both Russia and western nations such as France their strategic partners.

;

;“We respect our friends, we are here when they need us and we respect their independence,” Macron said. “And in a world where major powers want to become hegemons, and where regional powers become unpredictable, it is good to have friends who share this philosophy.”

;

;Asked about Macron's visit, the Kremlin spokesman Peskov said Russia valued its relations with Kazakhstan “very highly”. He told reporters: “In our turn, we have historical ties, ties of strategic partnership with Kazakhstan, they are our allies and our interests are united in many international bodies.”

;

;Several French presidents have visited Kazakhstan since the fall of the Soviet Union, but Macron will be the first to go to Uzbekistan since the late French leader François Mitterrand visited in 1994.

;

;Despite their declared wish for political liberalisation, both Central Asian countries are authoritarian states where protests are often violently repressed. In 2022, crackdowns on riots killed 238 people in Kazakhstan and 21 in Uzbekistan.

;

;The Elysée said Macron would emphasise the “reform dynamic” in Uzbekistan and that the issue of the rule of law would be brought up during his visit.

;

;On Wednesday afternoon, Macron addressed Kazakh students in English, speaking about the Middle East.

;

;He said: “I hate this debate dividing people and saying: 'For me Jewish lives are more important' or 'for me Palestinian lives would be more important'. This is crazy.”

;

;He said: “All lives matter in this world.”

;

;Macron added: “You have to attack and punish the terrorist groups but civilians are not the ones to attack … You have to protect civilians in your counter attack ... in order to focus on the terrorist groups. I want to make this distinction because all lives matter in this world,” he stressed.

;

;He said this was why France and other EU leaders called for a humanitarian pause in the fighting.

;

;“We have to protect first civilians in Gaza. Because they have nothing to do with these terrorist attacks,” he said.

;

;;Agence France-Presse and Reuters contributed to this report;

;The Italian prime minister, Giorgia Meloni, told a prank caller posing as an African leader that there was “a lot of tiredness” over the war in Ukraine and that she had some ideas up her sleeve on how to “find a way out”.

;

;Meloni's office confirmed that she had been “misled” into the phone call – reportedly by two Russian comedians – that took place on 18 September “by an impostor who passed himself off as the president of the African Union Commission”.

;

;According to reports in the Italian press, the callers were two Russian comedians, Vladimir Kuznetsov and Alexei Stolyarov, jointly known as Vovan and Lexus, one of whom presented himself to Meloni as “an African politician”.

;

;Vovan and Lexus, who are strongly pro-Russia, have been accused of having links to Russian intelligence services, although there is no evidence to substantiate the allegation.

;

;A recording of the call was published on the Canadian video-sharing platform Rumble before being picked up by the Russian state-owned news agency Ria Novosti.

;

;“There is a lot of tiredness on all sides,” Meloni is heard saying regarding Russia's war in Ukraine. “The moment is approaching when everyone will understand that we need a way out.

;

;“Ukraine's counteroffensive is not going as expected … It has not changed the fate of the conflict, and everyone understands that [the conflict] could last many years if we don't find a solution. The Ukrainians are doing what they have to do and we are trying to help them.”

;

;The problem, Meloni said, was “finding a way out that is acceptable for both sides without destroying international law”.

;

;She added: “I have some ideas on how to manage this situation, but I'm waiting for the right moment to put them on the table.”

;

;Publicly, Meloni has always been staunch in her support of Ukraine, a position that was reiterated by sources cited in the Italian press on Wednesday.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Giorgia Meloni turns to Rishi Sunak to take battle against migration beyond EU;

;
;

;Vovan and Lexus are known to be adept at social engineering political leaders into taking their calls. Meloni's office said she was targeted during an “intense” period when she was working to “strengthen relations” with African leaders whom she had arranged to meet on the sidelines of the UN general assembly in New York between 19 and 21 September.

;

;Meloni has also been seeking the help of African leaders to stop migrant vessels crossing to Italy's coast, a topic she raised during the call.

;

;“Europe has for a long time thought that it could solve the problem by limiting it to Italy,” she said. “What they don't understand is that it's impossible. The dimension of this phenomenon is such that it involves not only the EU, but in my opinion also the UN. The problem is that others don't care, and everyone agrees that Italy must solve this problem alone.”

;Pakistan has begun arresting and deporting Afghan refugees who missed Wednesday morning's deadline for them to leave, a government minister has announced. At least 200,000 people have already returned to Afghanistan voluntarily, said Pakistan's acting interior minister, Sarfraz Bugti.

;

;The ;crackdown on unregistered foreigners;, part of Pakistan's new anti-immigrant policy, affects some 2 million Afghans thought to be in Pakistan without documentation.

;

;Bugti said: “There will be no compromise against illegal refugees. We have the data on who are staying illegally in Pakistan. We are going door to door, and we have done; geofencing;. We will detain and deport them. We have arrested dozens across the country so far, including in the capital.”

;

;Pakistan's policy of forcibly returning refugees has drawn widespread criticism from UN agencies and rights groups, and from the Taliban administration in Afghanistan, which has urged its neighbour to give undocumented Afghans more time. ;

;Refugee holding camps have been established for the thousands waiting to cross the border. ;

;“I will see what I can do to survive in Afghanistan after I reach there. I have tried to contact those who have reached Afghanistan to know how they are doing, but I failed. Uncertainty waits for many of us,” said Mohammed.

;

;Pakistan started ;rounding up Afghan refugees; before the deadline had expired, and police have been accused of the harassment of both illegal and legal refugees. In the Chaman camp, Saddam, who moved to Pakistan seven years ago, said the constant police raids had made him leave. “They were raiding, arresting and harassing us, and I was forced to leave for Afghanistan. The police were hurting our dignity by their cruel behaviour.”

;

;Also in the camp was Mir Agha, 23, who said: “I was born and raised in Pakistan. All my siblings were born here. We had proof of refugee cards given by the UNHCR but they were scissored by the police after they arrested us.

;

;“Pakistan is now home, not Afghanistan, and we will be refugees there. We can't relate there. We are refugees in both countries. I'm worried about how I will survive and live there.”

;

;Chaman region border official Raja Athar Abbas;; ;;said authorities have deported at least 4,000 people on Wednesday. For the 1,000 refugees in the camp, he said: “We are providing them boarding, lodging, food, medical and municipal services, and we have registered them with us before we deport them,” he said.

;

;The UNHCR has ;raised fears over forced deportations;, especially of minorities, journalists and women, who are at risk under the Taliban regime. Pakistan's foreign ministry spokeswoman, Mumtaz Zahra Baloch, said these groups would not be forced to return: “The fear of deportation of journalists, activists and minority groups are in our notice and we will take due precautions.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;'We're so fearful': Pakistan rounds up Afghan refugees for deportation;

;
;

;But thousands of Afghans who worked for the US, Britain and other western countries before the Taliban takeover are stranded in Pakistan. If they are not taken to the west by the deadline, we have to declare them illegal refugees, then detain and deport them,” said Bugti.

;

;A senior US official estimated that there are still 25,000 Afghans who could be eligible for resettlement in the United States. “We are actively reaching out to and communicating with those individuals.
